New York University Abu Dhabi Library
Zaki Nusseibeh Collection
Nusseibeh, Zaki, His Excellency, 1946-
AD.MC.020
149 Photographic Prints
1940s-1980s 1970-1980 1 - Digital copy only
Content Description
The Zaki Nusseibeh Collection comprises of 149 gelatin silver prints scanned at 400ppi, they are mainly press shots of Sheikh Zayed and Zaki Nusseibeh on numerous state visits including to India, Pakistan, Morocco, France, the USA and UK. There are also some photographs of buildings and streets in Abu Dhabi and Al Ain, the bulk of the images are dated between 1970-1980.
Biographical / Historical
Zaki Nusseibeh was born in Jerusalem, studied there and in Cambridge University, UK, gaining a Masters degree in Economics. He moved to Abu Dhabi in 1967 and became Sheikh Zayed's personal translator in 1968 being bestowed UAE citizenship shortly afterwards.
He has held various positions within the Abu Dhabi government including Director of Information, Director of the Press Office for HH the President, Assistant Minister of Foreign Affairs and International Co-operation and Cultural Advisor at the Ministry of Presidential Affairs, Deputy Chairman of the Abu Dhabi Culture and Heritage Authority, and most recently Minister of State. He has also served on numerous boards, including; Chairman of the London School of Economics LSE Middle East Centre Advisory Board and member of London School of Oriental and African Studies SOAS Middle East Centre Advisory Board, and of the Alliance Fran√ßaise Foundation in Paris. He was also the President of the Alliance Francaise Abu Dhabi and the UAE chapter of the International 'Friends of Richard Wagner' society. He helped in founding the Abu Dhabi Classics program in Abu Dhabi and the Al Ain Music Festival in Al Ain. In 2014 he was also asked to chair the Wagner Foundation in Leipzig, Germany and is a member on the Board of Trustees of the Agha Khan Museum in Toronto and of the Institut du Monde Arabe in Paris.
